'Threshold House' is one of several record labels created by Coil to release
their own work and that of affiliated projects. Associated labels
include Eskaton and Chalice. It is also the name for the
[http://www.thresholdhouse.com/ official Coil website].

The label was initially a vanity label of sorts, as all releases were
manufactured and distributed by other labels, most prominently World Serpent
Distribution. Following the bankruptcy of World Serpent,
the label continued independently.

The logo for Threshold House is a castle-like building, possibly what Coil have
referred to as "The East Tower" in past interviews, and a moon. It is also very
similar to artist recreations of the buildings at Catalhoyuk.

After the death of John Balance and the disbanding of
Coil, Peter Christopherson started a solo effort, The Threshold HouseBoys Choir,
based on the name Threshold House.
